model_answer:
The events that most directly set up the decision to head back in event 15 are:

  * Event 12: Her acknowledgment of not having properly planned her route and the fact that her car is parked elsewhere suggests she may have realized she was in over her head and needed to turn back early.
  * Event 14: Her confirmation of the time being half past two and her statement that she must turn back by four o'clock indicates that she has a strict time constraint and needs to return to base before darkness sets in.

Therefore, the selected options are A and C.
A: Event 1 — She had just called them “Scottish sheep” and mentioned “little lambs,” even though the visual clearly shows a horned, shaggy Highland cow right beside a mossy tree.
